title: 110_hr4130
content: The "Montgomery GI Bill Enhancement Act of 2007" allows certain active-duty personnel to enroll under the Montgomery GI Bill. The Montgomery GI Bill Enhancement Act of 2007 allows qualified active-duty personnel to make an irrevocable election to receive basic educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of each military department will establish procedures for this election within one year of the enactment of this section. The Montgomery GI Bill Enhancement Act of 2007 allows qualified active-duty personnel to receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code. A qualified individual must have first joined the Armed Forces before July 1, 1985, served continuously on active duty, and completed high school or equivalent before applying for benefits. The Montgomery GI Bill Enhancement Act of 2007 allows qualified active-duty personnel to receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code. A qualified individual must have completed high school or equivalent and received an honorable discharge from active duty. The individual can elect to receive basic educational assistance, which will result in a reduction of their basic pay until a total reduction of $2,700 is reached. The Montgomery GI Bill Enhancement Act of 2007 allows qualified active-duty personnel to receive educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code. A qualified individual can elect to receive basic educational assistance, resulting in a reduction of their pay until a total reduction of $2,700 is reached. The Secretary concerned shall provide an 18-month period for the individual to pay the amount due. The Secretary ensures the collection of the amount due for educational assistance. No modification to eligibility period for basic educational assistance. Educational allowance is not paid until the applicable amount is collected or retired pay is reduced. Notice of the opportunity to elect educational assistance is provided by the Secretary in conjunction with the Secretary of Defense. The amendment allows for entitlement to educational assistance under chapter 30. Conforming amendments are made to section 3017(b)(1) of the title. A clerical amendment is also included in the table of sections. Opportunity for certain active-duty personnel to enroll in educational assistance under chapter 30.
